---
title: Quotas and Limitations
---
```{=html}

This section defines four user types defined for the use of the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem and presents quotas table for each user type.<br><br>

For each user type, specific quotas have been defined. The goal of such limitations is to provide optimum services for different user groups and allow for fair sharing of free tier resources within these groups.<br><br>

The following limitations and quotas are monthly and reset on the first day of every month:<br>
  <ul>
    <li>Requests per month</li>
    <li>Requests per minute</li>
    <li>Processing units (PU) per month</li>
    <li>Processed Products per month</li>
    <li>Credits per month</li>
  </ul>

The following limitations and quotas are applied based on a rolling window of 30 days:<br>
  <ul>
    <li>Monthly transfer limit (TB)</li>
  </ul>

The total volume of downloads from the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem for each user account is summed up for the last 30 days. Downloaded volume is checked on an hourly basis, and if it exceeds the assigned quota (based on role, i.e. Copernicus General User), then that user will be moved to a slower interface. Such a user will still be able to access and download products but at a reduced speed.<br><br>

Once the cumulative transfer for the last 30 days falls below the limit assigned to their role/category, the transfer speed will be restored to its nominal capacity. The monthly transfer limit applies to all user categories.<br><br>

In addition, the following limitations apply continuously:<br>
  <ul>
    <li>Number of concurrent connections limit</li>
    <li>Bandwidth limit per connection</li>
  </ul>

```
